results.snippet: "HAMBURG is a very strange place," Karen Black, just back from two weeks in the great German seaport, was saying the other day. "It's so very white  and so very serious. You never see any black or brown faces. Everyone wears glasses and vests and...
results.lead_paragraph: "HAMBURG is a very strange place," Karen Black, just back from two weeks in the great German seaport, was saying the other day. "It's so very white and so very serious. You never see any black or brown faces. Everyone wears glasses and vests and carries briefcases. The men all wear cravats. They also smoke pipes.

results.snippet: James A. Lovell Jr., the astronaut  who flew two lunar missions and long held the record for most time spent in space, has taken on what he calls a "David and Goliath scenario" to champion small telecommunications companie against the gigantic...
results.lead_paragraph: James A. Lovell Jr., the astronaut who flew two lunar missions and long held the record for most time spent in space, has taken on what he calls a "David and Goliath scenario" to champion small telecommunications companie against the gigantic American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

results.abstract: NASA names 35 new candidates to be astronauts in space shuttle program, including 6 women and 3 blacks--1st chosen for Amer space activities; group will start 2-yr training period in July; women will be trained to conduct scientific, engineering and med studies; include biochemist Dr Shannon W Lucid; Johnson Space Center dir Christopher C Kraft Jr comments on selection of women; candidates listed (M)

headline.main: 35 Chosen Astronaut Candidates; Six Are Women and Three Blacks; Group Picked From 8,079 Applicants to Start Two-Year Training in July for Orbital Missions Women's Movement Credited

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16--Officials of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration today named 35 new candidates to be astronauts in the space shuttle program. Six of the candidates are women, the first chosen for American space activities.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times
